name: places/ChIJFxvb93CR9pQR0_3XG1UtHhM
formattedAddress: Av. das Cataratas, 3175 - Vila Yolanda, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85853-000, Brazil

editorialSummary.text: Casual tropical resort offering multiple pools, dining & a spa, plus entertainment & a kids' club.

text.text:
We stayed for 7 days in late August so we got a good sense of how this hotel operates during shoulder season.

Check in was speedy. We got wrist bands as keys which is really much nicer than a key card and you don’t lose it. We paid for half board, buffet breakfast and dinner.

The food is average. It isn’t top quality, but what saves it is the variety. For example, every night the chicken and meat dishes were dry, but the soup and salad offering gave you options of higher quality. The arroz con leche was delicious. Drinks are not included so if you only drink water o suggest bring your own.

Even during low season the hotel is 80% families with small children. They even offer babysitting services so this must be a haven for parents. For a couple traveling though it wasn’t as quiet and relaxing as we would hope. The pools and buffet always had kids running around. The hallways too, so sleep with white noise on. We knew this is what the hotel goes for after reading other reviews so no complaints, that’s just how it is.

I got one message during my stay and it was very mediocre. Therapist’s hands were dry and technique very average.

Overall though, we had a good experience. The beds were very comfortable, the food abundant, and the pools very nice. The location is excellent as it’s super close to the Argentina border so going to Iguazú on that side is easy. There is a mall right in front of the hotel, very easy to walk to, for shopping and lunch.

text.text:
staff is very antipat ,,, bery bad service. no help even good morning they do not respond... good hotel but for the cost benefit is very bad!!! do not justified the price .
we asked to stay more 2 hour on the room , and hotel was 50% ocupied and they asked money... this is the first time that on this kind of hotels they asked money for more 2 hhours !!

originalText.text:
staff is very antipat ,,, bery bad service. no help even good morning they do not respond... good hotel but for the cost benefit is very bad!!! do not justified the price .
we asked to stay more 2 hour on the room , and hotel was 50% ocupied and they asked money... this is the first time that on this kind of hotels they asked money for more 2 hhours !!

text.text: This is a huge resort with many pools, a water park (separate) so there are many children. The staff was nice, but it was hard to get information about anything because there was no printed information, no signs with operating hours, no brochures at the tour desk (which closed at 2 pm, it turned out) and hardly anyone spoke any English. I don't expect the staff to speak English but without any printed info that I could translate, I spent the first days confused about how to get a reservation at a restaurant or tour information. I ended up doing all my research online and made my own arrangements. The rooms were large, wifi was spotty except in the lobby and the water pressure was variable so the shower water temp cycled through several temperatures. We also stayed at another nearby hotel where everyone spoke English, the tour desk had printed info and wifi was strong.

I don't expect the staff to speak English but without any printed info that I could translate, I spent the first days confused about how to get a reservation at a restaurant or tour information. I ended up doing all my research online and made my own arrangements. The rooms were large, wifi was spotty except in the lobby and the water pressure was variable so the shower water temp cycled through several temperatures. We also stayed at another nearby hotel where everyone spoke English, the tour desk had printed info and wifi was strong.

text.text:
Awful experience. We got stuck with my one year old BABY on the Tirolesa tower (8 floors high). We went up to say good by to my partner (following a suggestion from one of the employees) and the elevator broke down.
It was getting dark and after one hour they said the only option was to go in the tirolesa. We had to jump with my baby against my wishes. It was a very stressful situation for both him and me.
The hotel management wasn’t even aware that this had happened when I reached out to reception later that night. They said they would investigate and write back and they have been avoiding my calls ever since. I never got a proper apology. Shameful. Really shameful.
Wouldn’t recommend staying there.

name: places/ChIJtyl8jJOQ9pQR1JwFrQR5Ubc
formattedAddress: Av. Costa e Silva, 3500 - Parque Pres. 1, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85863-000, Brazil

editorialSummary.text: Upscale spa resort with thermal pools & a gym, plus restaurants, bars & a nightclub.

text.text:
Beautiful complex. Swimming pools are numerous and additional hot tub and pool on downstairs level.
Buffets for dinner and breakfast were large with many selections.
Rooms were spacious.  No view because we looked into another building.
Location seemed isolated. Nothing to walk to but we were on a tour so the location worked

originalText.text:
Beautiful complex. Swimming pools are numerous and additional hot tub and pool on downstairs level.
Buffets for dinner and breakfast were large with many selections.
Rooms were spacious.  No view because we looked into another building.
Location seemed isolated. Nothing to walk to but we were on a tour so the location worked

text.text:
We really enjoyed our stay at Recanto Cataratas Thermas Resort & Convention. The dining hall offers a buffet for about 27 USD, if I'm not mistaken. For vegetarians, there is unfortunately a limited selection, but a staff member (or perhaps the manager) of the restaurant was very attentive and made sure we were satisfied. He arranged a very tasty vegetarian burger for us at no extra cost, which was really great!

The breakfast was also very good, but it might be worth considering installing sound dampeners on the ceiling, as the breakfast hall can get quite noisy when it is full.

The pool was unfortunately dirty, and there was an unpleasant smell at the pool bar. The staff at the pool bar seemed a bit overwhelmed, and it took a while to get our cocktails. The whirlpool in the middle of the pool was empty and dirty as well. In our room, the bathtub was also not clean. These are areas where the hotel could definitely improve.

text.text: I am glad that we found this hotel, we even extended our stay in Foz do Iguassu, excellent service, wonderful food, staff well trained

originalText.text: I am glad that we found this hotel, we even extended our stay in Foz do Iguassu, excellent service, wonderful food, staff well trained

text.text: My family had a terrific experience staying at Recanto Cataratas recently.   5 star review across the board for our stay.  Great location for accessing waterfalls and other touristy stuff near the falls.  It rained 2 of 3 days while we were there and the resort had ample indoor activities for the adults and children.

originalText.text: My family had a terrific experience staying at Recanto Cataratas recently.   5 star review across the board for our stay.  Great location for accessing waterfalls and other touristy stuff near the falls.  It rained 2 of 3 days while we were there and the resort had ample indoor activities for the adults and children.

text.text: They charge like they were next to the Caribbean sea, but they don't offer all inclusive service. You have breakfast, dinner and lunch. Drinks are not included. They have poor connectivity for the ones that need to work eventually. The Internet is not so good, and there are almost no power plugs in the public areas and also at the room there were only 2 (bathroom and one next to the bed) for a family of 4, you have to organize yourself to charge devices. The great thing is that just across the avenue is located in, There is a big supermarket (MAX) and you can go and get anything you don't want to pay extra. The small (1/2 Lt) water bottle was like $1.5 and the same at the supermarket was $0.25. they really overcharged drinks.

name: places/ChIJsS6XbziQ9pQRIun6lQYHQvI
formattedAddress: R. Tarobá, 1048 - Centro, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85851-220, Brazil

displayName.text: Tarobá Hotel em Foz do Iguaçu

text.text: I was here for a four day honeymoon and really liked it. Hotel's location on a busy street in the city of Foz Do Iguaçu made for easy access to amenities such as supermarkets and Uber transportation. Our room was well equipped, spacious; regularly and well cleaned. Overall, hotel staff were very professional, efficient and friendly.

originalText.text: I was here for a four day honeymoon and really liked it. Hotel's location on a busy street in the city of Foz Do Iguaçu made for easy access to amenities such as supermarkets and Uber transportation. Our room was well equipped, spacious; regularly and well cleaned. Overall, hotel staff were very professional, efficient and friendly.

text.text:
Goodies: The place was really enjoyable, nice comfortable room, bed was good to rest, place with good air conditioning all over.
The hotel has a tours company close to reception that helped us find a great tour in the nature. The breakfast was optimal typical Brazilian wonderful breakfast. Hygiene safety measures were taken during breakfast. Open bar till late. Price was as expected.

Baddies: The pool is very small. Don’t expect to be able to find a resort-ish relaxing sunbathing time. That’s not here. Would definitely go back though! Thanks.

Stay: November 2020.

Stay: November 2020.

text.text: Do not book this hotel last minute. They are poorly prepared to receive last minute bookings and even worse at remediating their overbookings. They didn't have any rooms available so I was offered a room at their inferior budget hotel instead, for the same price as I paid for this hotel but without any of the amenities. They did not want to let me cancel and insisted that it was the website's fault. After three wasted hours, they relented and finally let me cancel and I went to the hotel next door instead.

text.text: Reception staffs speaks very fluent English.  They are very informative about how to get around, where to shop and eat.  Some even would go above and beyond to help.  I've stayed at 5 stars hotel before but sometimes their staffs might not be as helpful as this place.  Their breakfast is very good too, lots of choices.  This is the best value hotel.

text.text: Great hotel in Foz do Iguaçu — absolute recommend booking it.  Front desk upgraded our room upon arrival and was very helpful in providing information on the city and how to visit the falls.  Front desk spoke great English and was very friendly.  Breakfast spread was impressive.  One of our favorite hotels in Brazil.

name: places/ChIJiZWyAkmQ9pQRwcJYcji0pOk
formattedAddress: R. Alm. Barroso, 2006 - Centro, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85851-010, Brazil

displayName.text: Hotel Golden Park Internacional Foz & Convenções

editorialSummary.text: Polished hotel with 2 restaurants, 2 bars & a gym, plus an outdoor pool & free breakfast.

text.text:
- Comfortable bed.
- Very spacious room.
- Shower was powerful.
- Pool area is nice although not enough parasols.

- Both sockets by the bed in room 507 didn't work.
- Lifts were ridiculously slow and we spent a lot of time going up and down unnecessarily.
- The steps going into the pool are not secure.
- Not a 4 star hotel - a little dated, no bathrobe, no slippers, shampoo was in a sachet, very limited toiletries.

text.text:
The hotel was clean, the breakfast was nice, the service was amazing, the room had 2 plugs and only the one in the bathroom was working, the AC wasn't working either, the shower needed to be changed and the elevator was slow.

They have a very nice valet parking service.

The parking has an extra fee cost.

text.text:
Excellent location at the city center, within walking distance of several stores. A 24-hour restaurant/bakery is a few steps away. Nice options for breakfast, with lots of pão de queijo.
There are some amenities in the hotel, such as a pool and games.
Clean rooms, comfortable beds/pillows, and friendly staff.

name: places/ChIJWzfbRK-R9pQR3qJ80DPLdm0
formattedAddress: Av. das Cataratas, 4790 - Vila Carimã, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85851-300, Brazil

editorialSummary.text: Relaxed hotel with dining, lakes & an outdoor pool, plus expansive conference space.

text.text: Stayed here to visit friends from Brazil and visit the falls. The rooms were very nice. We paid the room price for the breakfast which had plenty of food for everyone to choose from. We were busy going places so we didn't sit by the pool much. It was a holiday so plenty of activities for the kids and music. They had a souvenir shop on site. The court yards were very serene.  The lobby was nicely decorated for the holidays. Staff was very attentive and helpful. You can purchase tickets for activities at a tour desk in the lobby.   They had a very nice new years eve party. Plenty of food   not close to really anything need to get a ride

originalText.text: Stayed here to visit friends from Brazil and visit the falls. The rooms were very nice. We paid the room price for the breakfast which had plenty of food for everyone to choose from. We were busy going places so we didn't sit by the pool much. Staff was very attentive and helpful. You can purchase tickets for activities at a tour desk in the lobby.   They had a very nice new years eve party. Plenty of food   not close to really anything need to get a ride

text.text: The stay overall was decent — food, facilities, etc., nothing spectacular, but fair for the price. However, on the last day during checkout, we encountered a major issue with payment. Despite confirming multiple times at the front desk that we could pay in dollars, we were only informed at the last minute that they would only accept newer bills. If we wanted to use the ones we had, they would take them at a lower value. This should have been communicated in advance, as if we didn’t have another form of payment it would  have been impossible to make payment. Very unprofessional and unethical approach.

name: places/ChIJ3cPKSLKR9pQRr9fJOS1yBrU
formattedAddress: Av. das Cataratas, 2345 - Vila Yolanda, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85853-000, Brazil

displayName.text: Bourbon Thermas Eco Resort Cataratas do Iguaçu

editorialSummary.text: Polished rooms & suites, plus 3 restaurants, 2 bars, a nature spa & a bowling alley.

text.text: This beautiful resort located near the Falls is perfect for kids and adults alike. They have Italian food, sushi, and a traditional buffet with food for every taste. They also have live music every night starting at 7 PM. The amount of accommodations for kids they had was impressive in itself.

originalText.text: This beautiful resort located near the Falls is perfect for kids and adults alike. They have Italian food, sushi, and a traditional buffet with food for every taste. They also have live music every night starting at 7 PM. The amount of accommodations for kids they had was impressive in itself.

text.text: The rooms are very dated and had a musty almost urine smell. Our first room had a broken AC unit and it took about 5 hours to get moved to a new room. Even then the AC could barely keep the room cool. The main outdoor pool was very dirty and in desperate need of resurfacing. The one thing that was good was the food. We did full board and really enjoyed the buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

We did full board and really enjoyed the buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

text.text: This hotel refuses to provide a kettle in the room and room service is always engaged and never calls back . As a result one cannot have a cup of hot coffee in the room  - an absurd situation!

originalText.text: This hotel refuses to provide a kettle in the room and room service is always engaged and never calls back . As a result one cannot have a cup of hot coffee in the room  - an absurd situation!

text.text: Nice accommodations all around.  Well supplied and functioning rooms.  Good breakfast buffet.  Great pool and tons of activities for adults and kids.  With all the energy sometimes a bit noisy but if that is a concern get a room further from the lobby/lounge/pool.  Lots of things to do very close by.

text.text:
It was beautiful, clean, and tidy.
The staff was exceptionally polite.
It was peaceful and pleasant.

name: places/ChIJN9Q_tzeQ9pQRUrRDnl4-h3Y
formattedAddress: R. Rui Barbosa, 394 - Centro, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85851-170, Brazil

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary all-suite hotel offering a restaurant, an outdoor pool & a fitness room, plus a bar.

text.text:
Decent option for an overnighter

The stay at the Wyndham Foz do Iguazu was a mixed experience that balanced some strong positives with a few drawbacks. While not a luxury property, it provides solid, dependable accommodation with amenities that cater to both business and leisure travelers.

LOCATION: Perfectly situated just a short drive from Iguazu National Park, the hotel offers easy access to the breathtaking waterfalls. It's conveniently located near local restaurants and has good connectivity to transportation options.

DINE + DRINK:The on-site restaurant serves a decent breakfast buffet with a reasonable variety of Brazilian and international options. While not extraordinary, the food is satisfactory. The bar area provides a comfortable space for evening drinks, though don't expect gourmet cocktails or extensive wine selections. They also have an attached Craft Beer bar with a fine selection of beers!

ROOM: We stayed in Room  1703, so this review is based on that;  SIZE: Spacious enough for 2 adults and simple baggage; VIEW: Sweet view of the cityscape; AIR-CON: Perfectly functioning cooler that helped in setting the perfect room temperature; BED: Comfortable bed that played the expected part of putting us to sleep; BATHROOM: Good sized bathroom with a Stand-in shower; TOILETRIES: Decent quality toiletries

FACILITIES: No Gym on site, didnt have a chance to check the pool

SERVICE: Friendly staff that cared for all our needs with a smile and made us feel at home and well taken care of.

HOW WIRED YOU WILL BE: Free Wi-Fi that works well all over the property, and the speed is good! Small Smart TV dishing out a wide variety of channels spanning sports, news, music, movies, and entertainment pretty much in PORTUGUESE language!

HOW WIRED YOU WILL BE: Free Wi-Fi that works well all over the property, and the speed is good! Small Smart TV dishing out a wide variety of channels spanning sports, news, music, movies, and entertainment pretty much in PORTUGUESE language!

text.text: We stayed on floor 21 and the view was incredible especially sunset/sunrise. The rooms were spacious and clean. Microwave provided which is always a great addition to any room. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and although we experienced some issues they were all solved. The breakfast is fantastic and a very big variety. There is also a tourist office for bookings which was very helpful and we used them once during our stay. There were lots of restaurants around the area which was also a plus. Location great. Downfalls: The Wi-Fi barely worked on the level we were on, the AC was loud, key cards sometimes don’t work. Overall I really recommend this place and would return.

originalText.text: We stayed on floor 21 and the view was incredible especially sunset/sunrise. The rooms were spacious and clean. Microwave provided which is always a great addition to any room. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and although we experienced some issues they were all solved. The breakfast is fantastic and a very big variety. There is also a tourist office for bookings which was very helpful and we used them once during our stay. There were lots of restaurants around the area which was also a plus. Location great. Downfalls: The Wi-Fi barely worked on the level we were on, the AC was loud, key cards sometimes don’t work. Overall I really recommend this place and would return.

text.text:
Poor and unstable internet connection. The Wi-Fi is weak and unreliable in both the restaurant and the apartment. In the bedroom, Wi-Fi and even LTE mobile data are unacceptable.

Two defective lights: one bedside lamp without a switch, seemingly the result of a poor repair, and a lamp in the living room that is out of order and barely emits any light.

Noisy and irritating air conditioning in the bedroom, which clearly needs maintenance.

No powdered milk or regular milk was available in the room.

Reception was not particularly friendly upon arrival, and the service at check-out was also unwelcoming.

In the lobby restaurant, it was odd that both the red and white wine were served at the same cold temperature.

Suitable for a short stay of one night, but not longer. However, I assume that is also the target audience.

In the lobby restaurant, it was odd that both the red and white wine were served at the same cold temperature.

Suitable for a short stay of one night, but not longer. However, I assume that is also the target audience.

text.text: Nice hotel with view over to Paraguay. Pool available. Restaurant is a little bit small for such big hotel.

originalText.text: Nice hotel with view over to Paraguay. Pool available. Restaurant is a little bit small for such big hotel.

text.text: The staff was nice and helpful, but the rooms were dirty and infested with cockroaches. The key cards don’t work if they’re close to your phone, so you’ll have to ask reception for a replacement multiple times a day 🙂.

name: places/ChIJW52kQlCQ9pQRgRXNZ8edyQM
formattedAddress: Av. Costa e Silva, 154 - Centro, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85863-000, Brazil

editorialSummary.text: Streamlined rooms in a stylish hotel offering an outdoor pool & a refined restaurant.

text.text: I had a brilliant stay here, in a room with a great view. The staff were very attentive and the breakfast was great. I left a little gift for the lady who cleans the rooms and after some time the hotel messaged me to check it was true, which shows their attention to security and having the right people working with them. I'll definitely stay here when next in Foz

text.text: The hotel offers a pleasant stay with spacious, newly renovated rooms and friendly staff who communicate effectively in English. The breakfast was good, and the overall experience was comfortable and welcoming.

originalText.text: The hotel offers a pleasant stay with spacious, newly renovated rooms and friendly staff who communicate effectively in English. The breakfast was good, and the overall experience was comfortable and welcoming.

text.text: Great hotel - good location - impressive breakfast- very friendly service at breakfast especially the extremely busy Natal who was so prompt with any orders - the food at their restaurant was excellent - their chef is amazing

originalText.text: Great hotel - good location - impressive breakfast- very friendly service at breakfast especially the extremely busy Natal who was so prompt with any orders - the food at their restaurant was excellent - their chef is amazing

text.text: Great hotel with very good cost/benefit. The pool is nice (even if somewhat dirty) and you can reach restaurants and a mall by walking. I would easily have rated it 5 stars if the pool was genuinely clean and if the breakfast quality improved slightly. Everything else is excellent and the employees will do their best to keep you happy.

I would easily have rated it 5 stars if the pool was genuinely clean and if the breakfast quality improved slightly. Everything else is excellent and the employees will do their best to keep you happy.

text.text: One of my best favorite hotel while visiting Brazil. It was the best hotel and location.

originalText.text: One of my best favorite hotel while visiting Brazil. It was the best hotel and location.

name: places/ChIJs2wuH7WR9pQRp0jyVjZmGaw
formattedAddress: R. Alm. Barroso, 866 - Centro, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85851-010, Brazil

editorialSummary.text: Straightforward property featuring an informal 24-hour lobby bar & complimentary Wi-Fi.

text.text: The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable.  It also was very basic (e.g., no toiletries aside from bar soap).  The hotel is just a couple blocks from a bus stop where one can catch the 120 bus to the Brazilian falls, the bird park, and the airport.  From the same stop, guests can catch the bus to Argentina.  Two decent sports bars with open air seating are within a block, as are a couple other restaurants.  Those seeking luxury should stay at the Sheraton or Belmond.  This is a solid choice for those interested in a more basic accommodation..

This is a solid choice for those interested in a more basic accommodation..

text.text: The hotel is very nice. The room is just like the other Ibis Hotels, nice and clean with everything you need. It's near restaurants and bars if you want to go out. Breakfast is very good with a lot of delicious options. Receptionists are very polite and helpful.

text.text: Great place to stay. Just around the corner you can get buses to National Park, airport, Argentina and Paraguay! Hotel was very clean. There was a great selection of food at breakfast time and it was replenished as it was used even if breakfast time was over. Once there were guests eating the staff made sure the full selection of food was available.

text.text: Location is good, but in global nothing special. Breakfast is poor and not delicious. Staff speak English very bad, they can't give you important information. Also they are so rude, no one told us 'goodbay' on the end. It's cost so much for what you get.

text.text: Great staff. We love staying at IBIS hotels. I hope more have space for a family of 4 so 2 rooms isn’t needed.

name: places/ChIJk7-4bPaQ9pQRR_bJUCdDOag
formattedAddress: Av. Costa e Silva, 1602 - Parque Pres. 1, Foz do Iguaçu - PR, 85863-000, Brazil

editorialSummary.text: Low-key lodging in a laid-back hotel with a restaurant & a poolside bar, plus free breakfast.

text.text:
I recently stayed at the Falls Galli Hotel in Foz do Iguaçu and had a pleasant experience overall. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, and I especially enjoyed the beautiful sunrise views from my window. The morning breakfast was also quite good with a nice variety of options.

However, I visited on Mother's Day and found the cake to be excessively sweet for my taste. Additionally, it would be helpful if the hotel provided nameplates for all the food items. One significant downside is the hotel's location – it is quite far from the city center, and there are very few city buses available, making it a bit challenging to get around if you don't have your own car.

Despite these minor inconveniences, I enjoyed my stay and would consider returning in the future.

originalText.text:
I recently stayed at the Falls Galli Hotel in Foz do Iguaçu and had a pleasant experience overall. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, and I especially enjoyed the beautiful sunrise views from my window. The morning breakfast was also quite good with a nice variety of options.

However, I visited on Mother's Day and found the cake to be excessively sweet for my taste. Additionally, it would be helpful if the hotel provided nameplates for all the food items. One significant downside is the hotel's location – it is quite far from the city center, and there are very few city buses available, making it a bit challenging to get around if you don't have your own car.

Despite these minor inconveniences, I enjoyed my stay and would consider returning in the future.

text.text:
Probably one of the worst hotel I have been.
The hotel was booked by my travel agency. Welcoming was nice but hotel and room are very old (but clean at least but no protection on matress), bed and mattress very uncomfortable. Location is bad because not in the city center : no restaurant nearby and most importantly right in front of the highway with very bad sound insulation so I could hear all the cars. I checked out 10 min and after checking in to go to a different hotel.

originalText.text:
Probably one of the worst hotel I have been.
The hotel was booked by my travel agency. Welcoming was nice but hotel and room are very old (but clean at least but no protection on matress), bed and mattress very uncomfortable. Location is bad because not in the city center : no restaurant nearby and most importantly right in front of the highway with very bad sound insulation so I could hear all the cars. I checked out 10 min and after checking in to go to a different hotel.

text.text:
A very basic hotel. You can tell they’re struggling with having enough staff members. Cleaning is very minimal, hotel is very outdated, food is not great. Anyone can eat breakfast, there’s no one checking if you’re a guest at the hotel or not in order to eat. The elevator is HORRIBLE, most people just take the stairs because it takes forever to get on the elevator.
I noticed the public bathroom by the reception desk had ran out of toilet paper so I went ahead and mentioned to the reception desk person. He apologized by saying two of their cleaning staff have covid and they’re short of help. I went and checked later and they had left the roll of toilet paper on the floor instead of putting in on the dispenser, the trash was overflowing from two days ago.

The bedrooms were okay, internet was slow and air conditioner worked. However our door kept opening if we didn’t have it fully locked.

This hotel needs some serious renovations and better service.

text.text:
Very old hotel with sub-standard rooms and service! The room is cleaned with bleach and is smelling even at the evening. The outflows of the bathroom are smelling very awful as they had been never cleaned! The breakfast is not good at all. At dinner, the cooked pasta is re-warmed by a waiter in a not boiling pot of water. The refrigerator is from the last century. The beds are dirty, had hair on it and are smelling bad like the rest of the room.
This is not a nice place.to stay!!!

text.text: The overall experience in the hotel was not good. The airconditioner was broke. The room looked like in the 90s and the half of the sockets didnt work. When we got help with our air conditioner he didnt get it fixed. The breakfeast was good but i would not try the crepes again.
